I can’t find much experience reports here so I wanted to know, to those people who use this amphetamine therapeutically and recreationally, how do you feel the “high”? What is your recreational dose?

I can tell from myself that Vyvanse is very euphoric in higher doses. I need 150-200mg for a recreational effect and 50mg for therapeutic reasons (ADD, impulsive). There is a long lasting amphetamine like euphoria which comes slow and fades away slowly; it’s not an “in your face drug”, effects start after 30 minutes and last up to 12 hours in my experience.

The side effects are not as bad as those of Ritalin as an example. There is just a very light restlessness sometimes and the hands are cold. The heart rate is just slightly higher as normal. That’s it from my experience. 

It feels like MDMA because the speedy effect is not as strong as normal amphetamine and you feel very empathetic and can control conversations and understand people more. The body load can be described as tingling sensations all around your body. You just want to talk and socialize.

In therapeutic doses it’s very effective for ADD symptoms, impulsive behavior is reduced and brain fog is gone; the head space is crystal clear.

I have a funny story, and thought I’ll tell you guys. 

A couple years ago in college, I decided I wanted to trip but didn’t want the 2-3 hour come up on acid until the peak, so I set an alarm at 6am, dropped a 100ug JOR tab, and set another alarm for 9am. 

Great idea, right? No. I easily fell back asleep, and woke up to the alarm in an extremely confused state and saw my straight edged Marine roommate who had no idea what was going on. I recall him looking like a giant and after a few seconds of intense confusion, I remembered what I did and decided, NOPE. I forced myself to go back to sleep because I didn’t want to navigate getting up and walking past him. Thank god for college sleep deprivation, because I easily fell back asleep and woke up around 4pm feeling almost normal again.

Other than the probably 60 seconds of confusing consciousness, it was intensely uneventful and I had no memorable dreams. None. And I felt much more sober at 4pm than I would have expected 10 hour into a trip. 

All in all, would not do again unless you weren’t living with a straight edged Marine LMFAO

But he survived because we called an ambulance and got him the help he needed, look out for your friends and get them help when they need it.

Stay safe everyone

It was my friend Rachels birthday, and with her and another friend, we organised a time where everyone had a full day free so we could trip and hang out together. I’m a student so at the time I was out of my home city living near my university, but I was able to come back to see my friends before my last semester started. I hadn’t seen my friends in a few months because they were busy working most of the time. I arrived at my home city and met with my friend Danny at the train station, after catching up for a bit with him we decided to head to Rachels flat; where we would spend the duration of the trip.

After we arrived at the flat, and ate some pizza, we discuss taking acid and how many hits each person wants to take. I had brought 10 tabs of 100ug from a reliable vendor, although they were untested. I wanted to take just 1 tab, I’ve tripped probably 10 times in total, but have never taken more than 2 tabs, and I’ve never really felt the desire to take more than that. My friend Rachel says she’ll take 3, to which Danny says he’ll take 6. I laughed and just assumed Danny was joking,  because while he has around the same experience as me tripping, he’s never taken more than 2/3 tabs, and idk 6 tabs it’s a bit of a jump. We go to the local shop to stock up on drinks and snacks and head back to the flat.

Rachels boyfriend was at the flat too, and after he left we decided to dose (he was cool with us all tripping and just wanted Rachel to enjoy time with friends on her birthday). It was around midday now and we all sat on the sofa in the living room and dosed. Immediately after I dosed, I asked “Danny, you really taking 6 tabs?” and he replied, “Yeah fuck it why not”, we all just started laughing, however Danny’s laugh seemed a bit more of an anxious laugh now, like he just realised what he did. About 15 minutes later things start getting weird, I didn’t feel anything yet as expected but Danny and Rachel were both talking about coming up already, and Danny started to laugh more anxiously and saying, “Ah shit maybe I took too much”, and I sensed some panic in the room.

About 10 minutes later, they both appear to be tripping quite hard, Rachel decided to go to her bedroom and lay on her bed because her visuals were too intense. I was watching cartoons on the Tv in the living room chilling, slowly beginning to feel the come up, and Danny is talking to Rachel about the visuals he’s seeing. I notice Danny starts to act more panicky, he hasn’t been able to sit down and begins pacing up and down the hallway. I ask him if he’s okay and tell him to try and sit down and calm himself, but he isn’t listening at all. He stops and talks to Rachel for a bit then begins pacing again. At this point I’m starting to trip, and my headspace is getting all fucky.

Danny is still pacing, and it started to freak me out, I kept saying to sit down with me and breathe slowly, but he just kept pacing up and down the hallway. I feel my anxiety kick in and realise this trip is the exact opposite of what I want to be experiencing right now, and from past trips this shit will only get worse. And of course, it did. While Danny is pacing, he half heartedly slaps the door to try and open it when he walks passed it, like he was hitting a fly on the wall. Then he walked passed it again, and I shit you not, looks at me square in the eyes and tells me in an almost demonic tone “**WE ALL NEED TO LEAVE RIGHT NOW**”, then opens the door and SLAMS it shut instantly.

I was very confused and didn’t know *what the fuck* just happened. It then came to me that Danny was not wearing any shoes. He also left his phone at the flat with his wallet and bag.  My friend just left the flat tripping balls, delusional as hell with no shoes on. I couldn’t react because I was tripping quite hard at this point and just assumed (or hoped?) he went out for a cigarette, something he often does while tripping to chill out.

After processing that freak out, I shouted to Rachel who was still laying in her bed tripping hard in her own world, oblivious to what just happened. I said “Yo Danny just left the flat, with no shoes or phone”. To which he burst out laughing like it was the most hilarious thing she’d heard all year. In my trippy mind I began to laugh too and we both sort of just laughed for about 10 minutes straight, then forgot why we were laughing. I tried to talk to Rachel more, but she had a hard time understanding me. I went back to the living room to watch TV. I didn’t forget about Danny, but I was tripping hard and really didn’t know what the fuck to do. I tried to call him, but of course he left his phone on the table in the living room, and once I realized that I started laughing again, to which created another laughing chain reaction as Rachel hears me laughing again from her bedroom.

After about an hour of me watching TV, tripping quite intensely now, Rachel comes to sit next to me, and we attempt to communicate. Rachel was evidently in a different realm to me and describes her visuals as colours melting everywhere. A side note, during this trip I did not have any visuals at all, just the acid headspace, which was very strange. Rachel then gets caught in a thought loop for about an hour, which tripped me out even harder. She thinks I’m Danny and repeats “You still seeing these visuals Danny” to which I reply, Danny isn’t here and you’re talking to me.

Eventually Rachel gets out of the thought loop, she asks me where Danny is, and I tell her again what happened. She was like “we should probably do something about it. I agree. We think about where he could have gone and eventually conclude he’s either in a bush somewhere tripping nuts, or has decided to go for walk, and will turn up eventually.

About an hour later I get a text from this guy who says he works as a security guard at a local hospital saying, “We have someone here called Danny and he says you’re a friend of his, please come and collect him from x hospital ASAP”. I was so shocked and worried about Danny, I kept reading the text, to ensure my acidy brain wasn’t going schitz. I showed Rachel and that’s when we both kinda freaked out and realised this is a serious situation.

After a lot of talk eventually Rachel called her bf and some of our friends and got a taxi to pick up Danny from the hospital. I was waiting in the flat the whole time they were gone, and my mind was trippy and extremely worried and anxious, it was horrible. Eventually they came back, and I watched Danny walk through the door. His face was red and he legit looked like a crack head, super on edge and his clothes were all ripped up and torn. I asked wtf happened and he just said he doesn’t know, then immediately started to argue with me. He kept shouting “why the fuck didn’t you stop me” and I just said he was acting delusional and didn’t know wtf to do, it really pissed me off that he blamed me. He stays quiet most of the night after that, but I talk to Rachel and she says he’s fine now.

Days later we find out he jumped out of a window and that’s how he got all the scratches and shit and got taken by police to the hospital. No idea what else he did while he was outside the flat to get nicked, but yeah.

It was a horrible trip during it I had this very uncomfortable ache/tightness in the very back of my head which didn’t shake for a few days. When Danny came back I felt like I could not communicate at all, like I just couldn’t form any words. I also had a really hard time understanding what people were saying, and if I was supposed to laugh or respond or idk, I couldn’t act human at all.

The trip kinda ruined acid for me currently, which is sad because I really enjoyed it before this little event. In the end I think Danny is irresponsible for what he did, and the fact he blamed it on me really made me rethink the friendship. Rachel was also pissed too because he didn’t thank her for getting him and could have gotten us in trouble with the law.

**TLDR; Friend took 6 tabs, had a psychotic episode and jumped of a window.**

First off, anyone who’s considering taking psychedelics, know why you want to do it. Introspection? Cool. Healing? Definitely possible. Recreation? Well alright, but that’s not always what you’ll get, as I experienced last night. I was semi nervous going into this because I had only gone as far as 2 tabs. But I’m glad I took 3. But because I went in with this uncertainty, I tried to trick myself kinda, so I just said “alright I’m going to just have an awesome time and not care about going deep into my mind. I’ll watch videos and have cool visuals and feel good.” 

And while all of those things happened, minus watching videos pretty much since I could hardly operate technology, what I received was much different than what I expected.

Expectations, might as well just siphon out all your gasoline from your cars and light em on fire because expectations go right out the window.

I learned how to let go.

I learned how to float.

Here it is.

////////

Took 3 tabs of acid last night. Anyone else get that weird jaw clenching feeling? Like they wanna clench their jaw cause your face feels weird?

Anyways I tripped absolute bællsæck last night. I spent the comeup attempting to be sexual but I had nausea and it got to the point where I just couldn’t anymore. Such a weird feeling. So I went to my bed and laid down listening to some music, Pink Floyd, whatever I could manage to fumble on through my iPad which made NO sense.

Also, the lyrics to comfortably numb finally make sense. Every line every word. Especially “you would not understand, this is not how I am” because I was trying to text my friend what I was experiencing but words are so bad at communicating psychedelia. 

Then come peak time around 6am, it starts getting light outside and I can see the blue and purple sky through my window. So I decide to go on a walk. Was kinda weird interacting with my dad but eventually I got out the door and just started walking down the street as the sun starts coming up on the nicest Saturday morning, as I’m beginning to peak on 300 mics. Not much better feeling I’ll tell you that right now.

The fucking trees. The HD. Everything.

Everywhere I walked, sprinklers would start turning on. As if I was controlling them by merely being in their presence. The way the sunrise started coming over the trees which by the way looked so pastel/cartoony yet hyper HD all at once. I remember saying to myself and my audio recordings “the replications are all so spot on” —> r/replications give it a visit if you haven’t already.

There was water on the side of the road and the reflections were so HD. 

How can life be so much more HD and awe beholding than real life perception itself?

So I continue to come to my peak, and I come to a point in the street where there’s a community entrance to the forest by my house. I’m feeling adventurous so why not. I walk into this tunnel of trees into darkness, and I wanted to stop to pee but every step into the woods was a whole new sight to behold and look at. I just stared up through the canopy of hyper realistic leaves and slight geometry (had some tolerance) and seeing water on the leaves. It was honestly incredible, and none of my other trips were even close to that beauty. I can only begin to imagine what is at higher doses than 300. 

I’d like to think I have a pretty grounded sense of self. I knew I could’ve gone deeper. And I will one day. But for now I can only speculate as to where my mind can go. 

Interested in trying shrooms and comparing the effects.

Also this was my only trip out of 5-6 ish that had any healing, medicinal, introspection and powerful feelings to such a degree. I felt like I finally got the cobwebs shaken loose as they say around here sometimes. Like it reset my brain as I’ve read. The weirdest part is I don’t even know what it did but I just know it did something. Something good.

Something that will allow me to enjoy life the way I think we all have a chance to.

Peace guys.

About a month ago I ended up abusing them a bit and started 0.25mg on a nightly basis for a month straight. I may have missed a night here or there but it was pretty much every night. 

Long story short, I stopped cold turkey and started getting horrible withdrawal symptoms. Chills, insomnia, diarrhea, electric feeling under skin, brain zaps and terrible rebound anxiety.

My doctor didn’t seem too concerned and said she would be very surprised if I became addicted to such a low dose. She even gave me a prescription of Klonopin and told me to not take it every night. 

I took 0.25mg yesterday after having a panic attack. Before that it was about 5 or 6 days before I took any and today I haven’t taken any. 

Oddly enough, today I feel fine. 

So my question is: is it possible or even worth it to taper off this amount or should I just bite the bullet and sweat it out? 

I’m gonna see how i feel tomorrow. Hopefully whatever was happening has passed but if not might try the taper.

Any advice or opinions would be greatly appreciated.

This happened about a month ago with one of my plugs that I’d been buying from for a couple years so we’d developed a sort of friendship over this time. He was always on time, had great supply that he would test and weigh in front of us because he seemed to actually care about us just having a good time. He even brought us lemon juice when we bought an eighth of shrooms so we could lemon tek and “get more out of the experience”. 

A few months before he killed himself he and his best friend (who also sells) got pulled over by state patrol while moving supply across state. At the time he had Lsd, shrooms, MDMA, copious amounts of weed, as well as varying kinds of benzos and opiates in his car. He posted on his story that he was facing 7 felonies and that we wouldn’t be hearing from him for awhile.

Well the next day he posts in full confidence “Your boi got off, not a single felony just a few misdemeanors”. Now me and my friends have no knowledge on how the legal system works but the fact they dropped “7 felonies” seemed crazy to us at the time. His best friend that was with him posted videos of him roaming the streets with one flip flop on asking people to cash app him money so he could get an uber to his grandmas. I had guessed that they had a falling out throughout the whole situation.

A few days later my old plug said on his story he was gonna pull up on his “best friend” and beat his ass. So obviously they were no longer the great friends that they were a week ago. I still don’t really understand the whole situation and how it played out that way so if any of you guys have any clue on how the legal system works I’d appreciate your input.

About a week later he makes his usual post on his story about what he has in stock. I’m with my friend who’s having his house warming party that weekend so he hits him up and asks if he could meet up tonight. The plug says “I can meet up around 12 but I’m killing myself tonight so I won’t be available”. Me and my friend thought he was just joking because that’s the kind of humor he’s always had so we didn’t suspect anything but we ended up not buying from him that day because someone else was able to meet at a more convenient time.

At around 10PM he posts “whos got xans and percs” on his story. We didn’t connect the dots, we just assumed he was restocking his supply only to find out that he had apparently overdosed that night. It’s not like we were that close but it’s just weird having that happen to someone you knew relatively well and interacted with on a regular basis. I guess I just made this post to get the whole situation “on paper” and I guess reminisce about a relatively decent guy who cared about the people he sold to.

This was my first time ever taking a proper psychedelic and I can say I was very intuiged by the experience. Firstly I took half a pill of 2c-b and had severla tokes of a joint shortly afterwards, I also took a tiny bit of dxm, 200-250mg I would estimate, only enough to normally put me on a low first plat with my tolerance.  It started off with me feeling slightly stoned after smoking, then however I noticed a different feeling emerging, it was hard to explain, it felt very clear headed but like I was focused in to every part of every moment, this didn’t allow me to think ahead too much. There was somewhat of a body load and I had quite bad munchies, all of my senses were heightened, colours were brighter but no open eye visuals. However at one time I chose to close my eyes and I saw lots of shapes and eyes but not that clearly. My friends were behaving quite goofy and talking a lot but I didn’t really partake in conversation. I decided to lay down with music and close my eyes, I listened to my normal rap then put on binaural beats. I wanted to see how far this drug would take me, unfortunately it didn’t go too far beyond CEVS. I was very self reserved the whole time, I felt like I didn’t want to waste this drug experience by socialising, instead getting the most out of the drug and exploring the headspace. Overall it was interesting and I’m eager to try it again, however I would prefer to try it in the comfort of my home, and a whole pill on its own instead of what I took today. I feel like psychedelics will be a very personal experience to me rather than social or bonding in the future.

EDIT: I am still feeling the effects of this and I am on the comedown, I feel fairly relaxed but tired. I don’t feel like my mood is low or anything.

Firstly, this isn’t a post telling you that drugs are the worst thing that has happened to this world, people react to drugs differently, life changing for the good or bad. This is a post on my own experience and how easily your mindset changes before and after drugs. This is my own introspective experience and won’t be this same with everyone. Enjoy 

I was 16, going to my first party. Prior the party I haven’t touched any substances, that wasn’t really common in my year, and I tried to promise myself that I won’t touch anything until I’m 18. There were many times where I was asked to try molly, to try LSD, and to of course drink alcohol. When this night came I no longer wanted to feel like that outcast who hasn’t had alcohol. Myself as a person I haven’t been the most confident, I was always that shy boy. But after I had a few drinks, I started to feel so confident and not giving a care in the world with what I did. I was jumping off roofs into the pool, hooking up with chicks who I never had the guts to even talk to, so many things happened in that night where I would not of even thought to feel comfortable for myself to do, I fell in love with alcohol. I started to drink every weekend for like 6 months with having a few week breaks through the 6 month period. My tolerance started to build up and it started to get expensive to get to the drunk state where I loved. So I started to not drink as often.

I convinced myself that alcohol reached to a point where I’m used to the effects and didn’t find that enjoyment I used to have off it but I continued to keep drinking to fit in with my social groups. Months passed and I started to meet this girl, at first I didn’t think much of it, she seemed to have a big interest in me always wanting to hang out so I didn’t deny her, I went along with it, she seemed really cool and I began to feel really comfortable around her, so comfortable, the most comfortable around anyone I know. I knew she was worth a shot, but didn’t want to rush into anything. She moved to my town which was about an hour away and she was familiar with drugs and just partying but never tried it herself but really wanted to, me being really invested into her I wanted to try drugs too then, without any persuasion I was buying myself 2 points of pure molly. My friend told me to try nitrous with molly, prior this I have tried nitrous and I also loved it but didn’t really put it in the drug category that molly is in. I had ten bulbs and 2 points of molly that night. Before I dunked the first capsule of molly, I was shaking and panicking so much that I didn’t feel comfortable but, I used the nitrous to get my mind off it. An hour passed and it kicked in. Never in my life have I felt so happy and confident in myself, I didn’t overthink of things to say or do. I fell in love once again to another substance.

I tried to convince myself to keep that 3 month break for molly, but I was too in love. I did it every week for about 3 months. I didn’t want to lose that confidence at parties. My bond with that girl got stronger and stronger and I started to keep using the molly to try and get closer and closer with her, it worked but then I hit a massive slump from her not feeling the same towards me anymore. This changed my entire life. I never have felt so happy and comfortable with someone ever. I couldn’t cope. We continued to be friends but I was still so emotionally invested in her and continued to take molly but not as frequently just to feel that confidence towards her. The reality of her not liking me always drove my comedowns off molly so terrible. I started become to rude towards her and calling her names and not accepting her moving on. It drove me into a terrible person and she hated it.

I stopped molly for awhile but still was so involve with escaping reality, I didn’t care about myself . I started to get back to drinking and to take nitrous, my nitrous use got intense every night out I inhaled about 30-50 bulbs with about 15-25 standard drinks. It got intense. This drove me not giving a shit about a single thing. My grades starting to sky fall, the income going to zero and my friends slowly going away, I only had junky friends who til this day aren’t my true friends.

I woke up one day and just wanted to change things up, so I bought my first psychedelic, shrooms. I bought two grams of it. It was a fun experience but didn’t feel like I got any benefits out of this drug as I did with molly. Months later I tried LSD, no benefits. I couldn’t find the escape and or confidence. So Xanax came along, I tried it and passed the fuck out. But the next day was beautiful, the afterglow made me so anxious free and not giving any care in the world, looking back at it, it’s scary how I felt like that. I continued this Xanax phase for about 4 days taking up to 6mg every night. After third night I mixed it with weed. The next day was pure sadness. I felt so guilty and couldn’t talk or socialise with anyone at school. This constant sadness and disappointment with myself went on for months. 

I was nearly 18 with no car or job or many close friends and my headspace was so dark. So many intrusive thoughts went through my head. No motivation to change. The only positive is that I stopped drugs for a while besides alcohol and nicotine and occasionally weed. I turned 18 and I was clean for a few months from everything besides the drugs I mentioned, so I decided to try molly once again. It was the worst experience ever. My anxiety drove through the roof and at the party I was at I just wanted to punch everyone in sight especially the girl who I liked so much, but I just sat there rolling so hard not talking to anyone, fucked out of my mind just smoking cigarettes.

The next day I told myself no more drugs Oliver it’s ruining you. About three months passed and I started to get a new car, closer to my friends again and getting a new job, until one night came. I saw on Snapchat that some really strong alprazolam pills were in from my mate, first thing I did is message my mate and he was keen for it, at the time being I was really happy and proud of myself with where I was but I just wanted to have some fun, didn’t think any bad from it. I took three... 2 days I’ll never get back, I don’t remember the full two days. All I remember is rocking up to some house stealing my friends nitrous and me driving home in my car with my mum crying in the lounge room. My mental state slumped to the lowest ever. I genuinely thought I needed professional help. I talked about it to a couple of my close mates and even some ex friends messaged me seeing if I was okay. But days after the incident my mental state got better I picked myself up and started to fix my life once again. I started to open up more to my friends, I started to find new jobs. I was truly working myself back up.

1 month has passed from that incident and I have never been happier with my life. I have promised myself I won’t touch any substances again besides low doses of nitrous and alcohol, but not as frequent as it was. Nothing so called “hard” drugs I will try again.

Moral of all this is that the people around you influence the way you think and become. Before I met that girl I was so anti drugs with my past dealing with drug related problems with my family and close people in my life. Be very careful who you are around and the actions you take, one night could lead into a disaster and regret. I’m only 18 and didn’t want to choose my life to be so invested in drugs. Don’t get me wrong, if taken safely drugs can just be a fun experience but I hope my story will lead people into intelligent choices. Don’t let drugs control you, take wisely or not at all, stay safe.

I apologize if this post is too long or lackluster, but I just really feel like expressing how wonderful this is:

I've been/ *AM* addicted to adderall, have been for slightly over a year now. Along with that, I've been habitually using oxycodone & hydrocodone.. and even hydromorphone since this summer. There is something about the relief and sedation that is just pure bliss. I must say, I have always been ***terrified*** of what painkillers/narcotics do to people and that is the exact reason I'm sitting here typing this.

After repeatedly upping my dose of oxycodone last week I decided it was time to have some self-discipline and stay away from it, but WOW, the cravings have been intense. The majority of my day was/is centered on getting that fix, that sweet release.

Came home today to get that fix and decided I'd ask my mother for some kratom instead as I imagined it had similar effects with less downfalls. Let me just say - I've done all 3 of the narcotics listed above, at extremely high doses, and they are NOTHING compared to kratom. If you have tried the harder narcotics, especially IV hydromorphone (which I'm sure a few of you have) *then you're aware of that pure bliss, nothing matters, life is fucking beautiful* feeling. With Kratom, I'm not exactly experiencing that, but why should I? Life isn't perfect and we're not meant to feel amazing 24/7. In fact, for once in what feels like forever, I have absolutely no desire at all to touch any other substance.

Anyways, I want to just wrap this up and say that I am extremely grateful for this plant. I'm realizing the importance of gratitude as a side note; with other substances this hasn't been present. ALSO: I apologize if I sound out of my mind, etc. but I know/understand that kratom still has dangerous properties when not used right; I truthfully don't see myself abusing this as my mom (bless her) is going to guide me through it and moderate things.

I feel like there is ***SO*** much more I could write about, (which I plan to, but in my notebook where I describe my substance experiences for personal reference) but I think I got my point across.

**TL;DR: Coming from a multi-substance addict... Kratom is AMAZING.**

**EDIT: (QUESTION) - why are we not prescribing this for certain mental health AND physical conditions as opposed to synthetic stuff?? It's mildly dispirting that we aren't recognizing the value of something the Earth naturally provides..**

If you want to get fucked up there are much more enjoyable substances out there that will cause nowhere near as much damage as benzos do. 

And before you tell me that they are meant for people with anxiety. This whole post is coming from a person with legitimate anxiety - I can assure you that you will get addicted to this substance no matter what.

I was abusing xanax, klonopin as well as clonazolam in the later stages recreationally for a total period of 6 months. On average I'd say I took benzos three days a week but given the stupid high doses I took during the semi-blackout phases and the fact that benzos half-life is absolutly nuts I was probably high 24/7. The memories of me using for the most part are very vague

Upon cessation I felt the withdrawal literally for 2 years straight

The withdrawal symptoms leave you feeling brain damaged - constantly feeling dizzy and not being able to focus on anything. Your intestines barely work, you cannot digest most food for months with no end in sight. Any type of GABA agonist causes those symptoms to spike. There was a time where while being 6 months sober I had a week long horror spike because I took a multivitamin with Magnesium which turned out to be a GABA agonist. That's how absurd benzo damage is - even certain herbs and foods tend to cause spikes leaving your symptoms at a baseline.

At the end of the day the "high" if you can call it like that is not worth it. It mostly comes down to not feeling or remembering anything which seems lame and indeed it is but somehow you are becoming addicted to it. Once you start using them the disinhibition makes it that you cannot stop using them. You don't even need to blackout in order to compulsively use them - for e.g. a clonazepam taken orally with no tolerance will probably leave you semi-blackout for 3 days straight - maybe not enough to not remember anything but enough to compulsively eat another pill a day or two days later down the road.

I'd say I'm currentely 90% healed. I can eat, I can think but there's no way for sure to say it hasn't left any scars on my brain. My anxiety is still there, has been for most of my life in fact that's why it's hard for me to assess the exact mental impact it left on me. I suppose I could try drinking a beer and see whether it causes another spike but quite frankly I'm too afraid to do that..

I'm still mentally addicted to drugs and I'm still using different substances such as stimulants,opiates, weed but compared to benzos I'm able to use them in moderation and can safely say that they improve at least some aspects of my life. But as far as benzos are concerned they will always remain a poison for me which I'm still afraid of to this day and which I will advise against to anyone I'll have the opportunity to meet in the future.

If you are currently addicted and want to wean off see a doctor. When stopping abruptly you might die of seizures amongst other things.

If you are currently in a PAWS withdrawal I'll link the best site which helped me eliminate problematic spike inducing foods and herbs from my diet: http://w-bad.org/reactions-setbacks/

This is just a post I made in order to share my personal experiences with **some** of the drugs I've tried and the problems I experience when taking them that other people do not seem to have. Hopefully I can gain some insight as to why this stuff happens to me and if I'm not alone. If you read all of this, thank you. I appreciate it. Anyways, here are my experiences:

* **Adderall:** This is by far my favorite drug of all time for many reasons, and I've done a lot of shit including LSD and MDMA. It gives me the perfect high, makes me the person I long to be and just so happy. It's great for me considering I suffer from major depressive disorder and social anxiety disorder. But the main issue I experience with Adderall is the fact that it lowers my sex drive, making it almost non-existant. I hear everybody say that if anything it makes sex all they can think about, being able to masturbate their heart out. It does make me last longer, but it doesn't make me think about sex or watching porn or anything. Is it supposed to or something? Because I'm not sure why it has this effect on me and the opposite for everybody else.
* **Phenibut:** Nausea is the main issue I experience when taking this drug, especially in higher doses. And when it comes to lower doses, I don't feel anything. Is this normal for me to have to take at least 1.5g to even feel anything from it? And is there any way to prevent the nausea that comes with it when it does affect me?
* **LSD:** This one is probably my own fault, but my main issue with LSD is bad trips. I've probably been doing it in the wrong set and setting, which is what's leading to them, but damn, Lucy just hasn't been nice to me lately. For my next trip I plan on taking it with some phenibut as apparently that's supposed to aid the trip and influence it for the better, almost like a guarenteed good trip is what I've heard people say about the combo.
* **Marijuana:** This one's a doozy. Weed and I have never really got along unfortunately. I've made posts about my dislike for weed before, but I'll add it here too just because and keep it short (although [here's](https://www.reddit.com/r/Drugs/comments/c1hsav/im_not_a_fan_of_marijuana/) the long version if you feel like giving it a read). Basically, weed just makes me very groggy, tired and releases no dopamine for me. It makes me ask why people even enjoy or would bother to do it really, so my theory is that it must affect others differently or something. I'm not trying to bash weed or shit talk those who use it at all so don't take it that way, I'm just saying that I personally am not a fan of it. If anybody can tell me in your experience what makes it so amazing for you exactly, I welcome your input.

And that's it really. Like I said, these are only some of the drugs I've tried. I just wanted to share some of my experiences and the issues I have with them. Drugs have changed my life and I will always be thankful for them. Remember to stay safe and use responsibly. I love this community and appreciate all of the support and insight. It really means a lot and I don't know what I would do if it weren't for you guys. Thanks for reading.

I started this account when I was spun out on Adderall and wanted to post my "ultimate guide to Adderall" which was quite popular and well received. I was using Adderall quite frequently, and when the supply ran out I switched to crystal meth. Wanted to share my findings, clear up some misinformation, and share the pros and cons of both substances. 

**ROA is Everything:** Taking meth orally or insufflated at low dose(15-25mg) without a tolerance the high is remarkably similar to Adderall. It feels like taking 40-60mg of XR that lasts twice as long, at low doses it actually feels cleaner with less side effects. When you smoke meth it's quite different, not entirely sure how I'd describe it, it doesn't really hit much faster than snorting, but smoking it makes it so much more addictive. You will be plenty high enough but crave hit after hit. The level and duration of high from smoking seems wildly unpredictable. It can be extremely euphoric or extremely anxiety inducing. 

**What does it feel like?** Imagine super long lasting Adderall with occasional euphoric rushes and empathetic feelings, kinda like what you get with MDMA, but much weaker, the lovey effects fade after regular use and it becomes pure stimulation. Meth also makes me horny as fuck and sex or masturbation feels incredible, far beyond anything I've experienced with any other stim. I'm a guy and can have orgasms that last a couple minutes while on meth. 

**Negative effects and harm vs Adderall** It's well known that meth is directly neurotoxic, although irreversible damage takes a long time to set in. Most people cannot use meth sparingly, but if you did manage to use it say once a month or less the negatives are pretty much identical. Acne and dry or oily skin, no appetite, anxiety, high blood pressure, dry mouth. The comedown is similar, mainly fatigue and depression. These can all be mitigated to some extent by forcing yourself to eat, sleep, and hydrate. 

What makes meth so much worse in this aspect is it's duration. Going on a 48 hour Adderall binge is difficult and quite expensive, if you're a first time meth user you can do this easily, just rail a 20mg line every 8 hours or so, for what I pay locally that means it takes about $5 worth of meth to go on a 48 hour binge, and you can keep going for a ridiculously long amount of time before the drug becomes pretty ineffective. This is usually what leads to stimulant psychosis, with meth it's possible for the average person to go as long as 5 days without sleep on less than $20 in drugs. In my experience I start feeling warning signs of psychosis at around 40 hours and that's when I've stopped. I've never exceeded a 2 day binge and I don't think I'd ever want to. With Adderall, by the time I hit 30+ hours it starts feeling like a caffeine pill, while meth just keeps going. 

**Addiction** Both drugs can by highly psychologically addictive when used recreationally. Taken orally, I don't think there's a significant difference. I was addicted to Adderall just as much as with meth, but ultimately the limited supply or high cost would force me to take a tolerance break regularly with Adderall. I believe the low cost, long duration, and option of smoking or IV use is what causes meth to be more destructive from an addiction standpoint. It's not typical for people to pick at their faces or act insane just because they're high on meth. The "meth zombies" you see are smoking or shooting it and staying up for days until they become psychotic, repeating the process for months or years. Meth cravings definitely seem stronger, but withdrawal is similar. Fatigue, depression, anhedonia, anxiety.. It's not an easy drug to quit, but it's nothing compared to what benzo or opiate addicts experience. 

It's also fairly common for severely addicted people to become poly drug users and form a dependence on opiates or benzos as well. When tolerance increases you get a lot more negative effects such as anxiety/panic and pain from muscle tension and either being "stuck" in odd positions for a long time or overexerting yourself.  Benzos and opiates can both act as sort of an antidote to the shitty effects of meth, but being addicted to both makes the situation a lot worse. 

**Conclusion** One-off use of meth can be very similar to Adderall and the effects are exaggerated in my opinion. Not everyone that uses meth turns into a psychotic tweaker with sores all over their face, stealing bikes to fund their addiction. I think the stigma against users does more harm than good, as it drives them to only associate with other users. That being said there is definitely a greater risk with addiction and harm with long term use, so I wouldn't recommend it. If it's something you really want to try I'd advise against smoking it. After over a month of near daily use it's lost a lot of it's recreational value. I'm still very functional and sleep every night, but it's not really fun anymore and every day I continue to use this shit the high gets weaker and the side effects worse.  

Let me know if you have any questions, I'd be happy to share.

I’ve took Quetiapine for a few years. It helped me sleep and reduced my anxiety during the day. I’ve started on 25mg, bumped it up to 50mg for a few months and back to 25mg. I’m pretty sensitive to drugs, I can’t even drink a small cup of coffee without getting tremors.

The problem I had with it is that it would make me sleep for too long, like, 12 hours, and I wasn’t happy with it anymore. So, this week I went to the doctor and got prescribed 50mg Trazodone instead.

The thing is, I haven’t slept properly since. Takes me hours to actually drift away and because of that I end up getting out of bed at the same time I did on Quetiapine, only with less hours of sleep.

But the worst part is that the anxiety is back. I wake up and I can’t eat or drink. I feel cold almost shaking and that feeling of impending doom I knew so well before...
Also a bit itchy... and no unwanted boners lol.

Now, is this because it will take some time for the Trazodone to start working? Is it Quetiapine abstinence or something? It’s been 4 days and I’m wondering if I should hang on for more time or if it’s clear it’s not working?

Thanks :)

This story happened about two years ago, when I was a young  stoner who had just recently discovered the wonders of weed to himself. Nowadays I can't smoke at all due to depressive episodes and anxiety that I started experiencing from weed, but back then I couldn't have enough of that shit. And especially I loved hash, more so than plain flower. 

If you remember my previous post and the other "drugs in russia" post by another dude on here who explained how stuff works in this vodka-soaked country, you probably already know that the way we get drugs is sort of a fucked-up game of geocaching. Geocaching with drugs as the endgame and cops in civilian clothes eager to get your ass, to be exact. 

So, as I'm checking the marketplace, I stumble upon a position which says "ЦАО Экстрим" as the approximate part of the city where the stuff is hidden. ЦАО means "central administrative district", basically the very center of the city, and "экстрим", well, means "extreme". So I thought, what the hell do they mean by "extreme"? Well, I just assumed that it's a name of a park or a shopping mall or something. Boy how wrong I was...

I pay in bitcoin, open the description of the address, and I see that the motherfucker has actually hidden the stuff RIGHT by the Kremlin. The most crowded, most guarded, most loaded by police part of the entire fucking city. 

See [this fucking ark here](http://photos.sochi.org.ru/var/albums/voyages/moscou/Kremlin-Grotto.jpg?m=1355146041)? To be precise, not the arc with the big white columns, but that small stone opening on the right. Yeah, that genius hid the stuff in some sort of opening between the stones inside, sticking it in the hole with fucking plasticine, the kind that kids play with. 

Obviously I'm shitting my pants, I called my friend and his gf for backup, said friend is sort of a homeless raver kind of dude who has seen all kinds of shit so I felt safe with him in this quest. After some swearing and laughter at the absurdity of the situation, we did manage to pick it up, and found out that the vendor had actually included a bonus for us, since it was such an EXTREME quest! It was supposed to be only one gram of hash for about 12 dollars, but what we got in there was like 1.5g of hash plus 0.3-0.5g of some good bud. 

All said and done, we smoked the bud in an abandoned yard that was left in place of a demolished building, a mere house away from the local police department. It was some good bud :)

I quit amphetamines after about 1 year's usage.  At first it was Vyvanse from a doctor (at an escalating dose), then I snorted/smoked meth for a month or so and quit cold turkey.  This was a few months ago, but I was probably 98% normal around 3-4 weeks clean.

I'm clean now, life is more or less normal, and I think I've mostly moved on from speed.  I've got a life full of goals and aspirations, and while drugs have in the past clouded those for just a moment, I've always been aware of the bottom line.

Given meth's notoriety for addictiveness and consuming lives, I think it's significant how I walked away from it so easily.  I'm not saying I have a god-given anti-addictive talent, but rather that drugs are often exaggerated in their effects.

I'm kind of tempted to try some sort of narcotic, but I fear that, if not heroin right off the get go, I'll escalate into heroin because I want to see the crème de la crème of opiods.  Deep down, I feel like I'm waiting for someone to comment "go ahead, it's not that bad", because I'm goddamn curious.

I hope someone can sway my opinion.  About a month before I did meth, I made a post like this and convinced myself I still hadn't made up my mind, but I really had.

One of my friend was running out of greens so he wanted to buy some from me when we meet at our workplace, McDonald's. However he overlooked his shift so we never met. So the weed stayed in my backpack.

At that time, I was at my grandmother's place and I departed to Switzerland 2 days after that. Since I left from my grandmother's house, not from home I couldn't just leave the stuff at her place so I took it with me... Aaall the way from Hungary to Switzerland, needless to say I was a bit scared on every border but it was like 2g and we were sitting on a bus full of children.. Oh yeah, the occasion! I was the interpreter of the Hungarian Delegation for the International Youth Firefighters Competition in Martigny. Nothing too serious...

We had to stay there for a whole week, it is like a giant festival and firefighter gathering all organised around an international competition and a great prize. On one of the evenings after talking to some Finnish, Croatian, French and basically every kind of person, I got bored, since every youngster who competes had to go into their room by 23:00. Then I saw a group co-leader from our delegation who was just as bored as me and we talked earlier about smoking weed and stuff. He was walking back to the hotel and I said jokingly that "I have weed on me, do you want to smoke?". I was surprised when he said yes... XD 

After some hesitation I sneaked into our room where the other delegation leaders were sleeping, grabbed my little glass container and walked out as fast as I could. I told him that I know a place that is all dark and is a perfect spot. I have to say that I saw people smoking weed there earlier and from the smell it was certainly weed... The local "gangsters" were pretty careless about choosing spot btw I saw many smoking casually at benches and stuff.

So yeah, we rolled it up, smoked it and went for a late night walk in Martigny, which really is beautiful at night. If you saw two red eyed blokes at around 1 am wandering on the streets, that was us!

Well, this is my story, nothing too special, but at least I can say that I was "tripping" both legally and illegally at the same time. I am looking forward to read similiar stories in the comments!

My little brother has been battling addiction now for about 5 years.  When it started he was about 18 and I was around 25.  He is now 23 and I am 30.  Today he called me from the rehab facility (probably 6th or 7th rehab over 5 years) and told me he is probably looking at 3 - 5 years in prison.  I'm not quite sure why I am writing this, but I have to get it out of my system.  I feel completely lost.  I have known for quite some time that it would either be prison or death, and the day of reckoning has arrived.  Honestly, I won't be surprised if he kills himself, or attempts to between now and the hearing.  It all started with him taking a Vicodin.  He was young and just had his heart broken by a high school crush.  The pills escalated from Vics to Percs, to oxytocin, and then ended with the old powder.  Xanax and cocaine along the way.  Overdoses, run-ins with police, pills purchased from dark web, and so much more have been the reality of my family.  I don't live back Home anymore and pretty much haven't since I graduated college.  I have seen what this has done to my parents (who are divorced), and I am so angry.  I once was full of hope, and now that tank of hopefulness is empty.  I cannot do anything to help or change this outcome, and coming to this realization is one of the hardest things for me to accept.  I cannot help and I feel absolutely helpless.  I am resentful and wish he would just disappear, but I know the aftermath will be my mess to pick up.  It is an awful feeling to know there is nothing you can say or do to make this better.  I don't even care what happens to my baby brother anymore.  I have been pushed to feeling this way about my own little brother and it makes me wonder am I broken?  The one I grew up with, played with, fought with, laughed with, and so much more. I hate who he is now.  I hate that every accomplishment I have had in life has been overshadowed by his illness.  I hate that for 5 years I have been the afterthought of my parents.  I hate that I truly feel he is a criminal and belongs in jail.  I hate that there will be no happy ending for this story and my parents who are both almost 60 will spend the last bit of their lives feeling like complete shit because of him.  I hate that I have to let my parents go because they can't let him go.  I am not looking for sympathy or anything, I just needed to get these thoughts out of my head and put them somewhere.  If you are still reading this and you haven't had something like this in your life happen, I want you to see what happens when you abuse and become addicted hard drugs.  It breaks the people you love.  It has broken my parents.  It has broken parts of me.  Sorry for the incoherent, sporadic, nonsensical rambling.  I feel a tad better now.

This story takes place back when I was in the 8th grade.

At that age, I was smoking weed at any given opportunity. Getting stoned was pretty much my absolute main goal in life. I didn't really care about anything else.

I had friend who was completely sober, who I'll refer to as Jake.

Jake was much older than me, probably in his early 20's. He didn't smoke weed, didn't smoke cigarettes, didn't drink, and didn't experiment with any type of drugs whatsoever. Compared to me, he could've been considered straight-edge. And he always looked down on me for smoking weed. Over the past year, it became incredibly awkward for him to spend time with me due to my marijuana use. And honestly, looking back now, I don't blame him for wanting to keep his distance. I was a pathetic unstable burnout at the time.

But one day, he agreed to spend time with me. Him and I were riding bikes around the neighborhood. We went a nearby church, where I then proceeded to light up a bowl. This was some super, super potent stuff. Straight up kush. Probably some of the strongest weed I've ever got my hands on. For whatever reason, I then relentlessly begged Jake to take a hit. I was like, "Oh come on man! Just take one hit! It's not gonna hurt you! Try it, just this once!" Seriously, I was acting like the devil. I wouldn't take no for an answer. I literally stood there for like 30 whole minutes trying to persuade him. And I must say, he didn't break under pressure that easily. But then, at the last minute, Jake said, "Alright f#cker, hand it over!" He then took a massive hit from the bowl and coughed his lungs out. Keep in mind, this was the very first time Jake ever smoked...like anything.

Moments later, Jake had a really weird look on his face. It was a facial expression of immediate panic, anxiety, and discomfort. He then sorta dropped to his knees and started awkwardly chasing around some leaves in the grass. I looked over and asked, "Uh, Jake, what are you doing?" He then mumbled, saying, "I don't feel good. I think I'm about to die." I then did my best to explain that he was just really high, and that the feeling would eventually pass. He then started sweating like crazy. He looked at me and said, "Dude, you don't understand! I don't feel good! Why did you do this to me?! How do I make it stop?!" He was clearly tripping. I then continued to try to keep him calm and tell him that everything was gonna be alright.

He then said, "I need to go home and get some sleep." Keep in mind, it was like 1 in the afternoon. He then started crying, jumped on his bike, and took off. I felt so bad for him. Obviously, he couldn't handle the high. I felt deeply ashamed, like I just did something awful. Now, one could argue that Jake was a full grown adult, and was perfectly capable of making his own decisions. But still, I felt bad. He never talked to me ever again after that incident. Until, one day, fast forward to 2013, I spotted him on the street, and we started chatting, talking about the old days. I then mentioned, "Hey, remember that time I convinced you to smoke weed?" He had a really strange look on his face when I mentioned that, as if I brought up a traumatic event. I still feel bad to this very day.

It's safe to say that Jake and I are no longer friends.

This is my opinion on the several methods of consumption, and also the several mixtures of chemicals you can use to make it more potent. Keep in mind, I’m quite experienced with most relevant opiates, oxy, hydro, codeine, tramadol, tapentadol. These chemicals mostly work the same so yeah. 

First off are the consumption methods. 

Oral with empty stomache: best preferred way. A normal lasting 2 hour high, just easiest to do and most rewarding. 

Oral with full stomache: frustrating. It’s like you pop 5 oxies and it’ll feel like 2 and a half, but last twice as long. If you’re on a mission, this is not the move chief.

Dissolve under tongue: Good, if you’re on a full stomach or just in a rush, this will be a nice loophole.

Snorting: very painful. The high is 2x as potent but will last maybe 30 minutes, and it is not fun to snort again. Watery eyes, burning nose, and awful drip. 

Now we move on to mixtures:

Ibuprofen: imo, makes the opiates work stronger as well as having a better analgesic effect. Many question this, though. But it’s ibuprofen, wouldnt hurt taking a bit. 

DPH: Makes a much “dirtier” High imo. But it does help you reach that depressed state where things really hit you. 

Grape juice: works. Simple enough.

**CONTEXT**
I have ADHD and finally decided to get it treated. After trip to the Doctor, I was prescribed, one, 70mg Vyvanse capsule per day. This is a very recent prescription that I have acquired only last month. I am just now starting my first refill bottle, or starting my second month of Vyvanse. I don't usually take it consistently, and skip days quite often. Today, I decided to take 2 capsules and see what would happen. As I am writing this, the high as almost fully worn off, which led to my decision of taking another 70mg capsule. I am currently waiting for it to kick in. With this in mind, here is a summary of how my night has gone:

**STORY**
I always read about how much people love the high of amphetamines and wondered what it was like. Today, I was bored and after reading some reddit reports, I decided to take the plunge and take 140mg of Vyvanse. If reddit posters could do it, why not, right? I didn't take both at once. Instead, I took the second capsule about an hour after the first, so it took a while for the 2 capsules to work together. And about 3 hours later, they did. When I tell you, I could understand everything and anything that I wanted to, I could. I came up with an idea of how to invent different things. I became a fucking genius. While that was fun, it gets even better. Eventually, the vyvanse kicked in to the point where I had superhuman focus. Instead of taking this focus out on my inventions, I took it out on myself. I became my fucking brain. I genuinely sat typing to my friend on my phone for 6 hours straight without moving or eating. That may sound like an exaggeration, but it isn't. I forgot any and everything existed. I was so entranced and so fixed on what I was trying to say and what I was realizing that I didn't exist anymore. I talked to my friend about myself only in the third person. I referred to myself by name or she/her. And the "I" that was telling my friend things was another fucking being beyond my comprehension. I was literally my own thoughts and only my thoughts. Everything else ceased to exist, even basic human concepts. I don't even know how to explain what I experienced. It was only a feeling I could describe as being God. Like I became my own God and I wasn't a person anymore. My person became a universe that my own God created and understood inside and out. I was all knowing. That is all.

and looking out... no, not really. That's the best way I can describe it.

Every movement is *executed* rather than just loaded from RAM like some renegade script that was designed to be the template for an action, and not a... an effective action. Instead, now, it's more like driving a forklift but never having driven a forklift.

I’m 20 years old and from England. For the past year or so I’ve been a functioning cocaine user to the point where I guess I could no longer call it recreational,  up until recent events I would of definitely argued that I didn’t have a problem and i could stop whenever. I went about my weekend in the usual way, I’d buy an 8th and sniff it over the course of the weekend usually stopping at 1/2am to allow myself to sleep and recover to start the next day, however on this particular weekend I thought fuck it I’m gonna stay up all night, so I carried on sniffing all Friday night,through Saturday into the early hours of Sunday morning. on the Sunday things took a turn for the worst when I broke out in cold sweats and kept thinking I could hear my dad and his girlfriend arguing in the room next to me and every time I went out there it was silent, I thought they were arguing about me for whatever reason and part of me knew it was deep cocaine psychosis but I couldn’t help but succumb to the paranoia and repeatedly check the corridor to see if the voices in my head were real or not. All in all it was not a pleasant experience. I knew I should of stopped there and then but I couldnt, I’d now been up for nearly 3 days and I was still sniffing when the pains started, it began as just a mild discomfort in my arm but it scared me enough to stop for a while. I had a short day nap to try and rest my body abit. When I woke up it was late Sunday evening and the pain had completely gone. I decided to start sniffing again, several hours in the sweating started, then the pain only far worse around my left arm and it felt like something was sat on my chest squeezing my heart. I knew what was going on but I thought maybe if i ignored it it will go away. I couldn’t exactly go into any of my families room and tell them I was having a heart attack due to cocaine so I left my house went to a school near it and called an ambulance, the pain peaked whilst I was on the phone to the point that I was curled up thinking I was dying. When the paramedics arrived they said I had a pretty sever heart arrhythmia with it beating irregular at a stupidly fast rate. I was rushed into hospital and after spending hours being prodded and poked with needles followed by x-rays I was lucky enough to not need a stent in my heart. I was discharged after a day of monitoring and was lucky to still be alive. I just wanted to warn you all that remember to be cautious when using coke if you are going to your are going to use it at all remember to sleep, drink fluids and eat food before and after even if it’s the last thing on your mind. Most importantly once any warning symptoms occur just do yourself a favour and don’t ignore it, it’s not worth it.
This was 2 days ago now and I plan on staying clean, no drugs worth it if it does damage like this, stay safe people.

It's taken me a few years to recognize it, but I am an addict.

It started during the last couple years of high school. My parents had just caught me smoking weed and grounded me. When it was over I started hanging out with a friend who's mom had an oxycontin prescription and would give us free percocet whenever I came over. I liked it because my parents couldn't tell if I was high or not, my eyes didn't turn red and I didn't smell like weed. I could be high all the time and nobody would know!

Fast-forward to senior year of high school, I am now taking 80-100 mg of percocet a day. I had a group of 4 people, my childhood friend I had known for over 10 years, my friend who's mom had the percs, and this other girl we knew. We would all go to the woman's house after school and do drugs until nighttime. My nose is constantly bleeding because my entertainment consists of deciding if I want to snort or parachute. I have probably 15 connections, none of whom I know personally, and I am spending over a grand a month. Every morning I start the day by puking my guts out and then running out back and smoking weed to make myself feel better, then railling another percocet. I had started dabbling in meth and had done heroin once or twice too. At this time I think I developed my eating disorder because I would starve myself to get higher. I starved myself every single day and even now I feel nauseous and have to force-feed whenever I eat.

I was heavily addicted for a good six months, which are a total blur to me now. I saw some things and did some things I don't like to talk about, but eventually my money ran out. I didn't want my parents to know I was addicted, so I pretended I had the flu and locked myself in my room for 3 days. Told my dealers to never contact me again and deleted their numbers off my phone (boy did I regret that by the end of day 1. I remember screaming at my friend to give me our connect's number and he was like "sorry bro, can't" I was so pissed). The withdrawals had me crying from pain. But I didn't consider myself an addict because nobody who's REALLY an addict gets over it that easily, right? They have to go to rehab and stuff, right?

At first, I felt awesome. I had finally given up something that controlled so much of my life and who I was hanging out with. Then, every day I started thinking about it and how much I wanted it. I started drinking heavily to distract myself. This continued as I went through college, I was drinking myself to sleep every night (when I wasn't on acid), and I started snorting heroin with this dude on my floor. To this day I think my alcohol and drug abuse in college was the sole reason I flunked out.

After college I was a total wreck. I was hella depressed and slowly started getting back into oxy and I was going to raves weekly and snorting meth and cocaine. I was living with my parents and I don't know how they didn't realize I was fucked up pretty much 100% of the time. Looking back on it, they probably did but my relationship with them was so bad at that point I'm sure they just didn't want to say anything until they had to. I ended up meeting a friend at the time, let's call him Matt. Matt helped me out of my slump, we'd go hiking and kayaking on the regular; only hiccup was that he was really into xanax and suddenly I was into xanax too. At one point he got me some 5mg roxies and I took 3 of them and felt awful. I swore I would never take oxycontin again.

Then my childhood friend died that summer in rehab. Totally ruined me. I started crushing a handle every night; my parents knew I was drinking too much and threatened to kick me out. Me and Matt ended up moving to Colorado because I couldn't drive around my hometown anymore without constantly thinking of my friend. I still blame myself for his death because I encouraged him to do drugs in the first place.

I still think I'm an addict. While I'm in a much better mood, I still drink every night and god I can't go a morning without weed. I still think about oxy and how much I want it but I can't find anyone up here who sells and I'm kinda glad about that. I haven't done oxycontin in over a year, but I'm still an addict. I still can't have fun sober. Shit ruined my personality and my health. I don't think I'll ever get to the point when I'm "back to normal." I am an addict and I always will be.

I found that if I vape 2-3 bowls I of the newish shit I have in my arizer air 2(which I should mention I bought a few gs of from another close friend the same night), then taking some nice pulls from my dab cart at the end of that, I slip into a psychedelic-like high which is really something only comparable to a nicely dosed edible.

But anyways after hitting the dab pen in this process I get some really weird body sensation, (overall body temp rises) and I feel I almost completely lose control of my thoughts, similar to how I hear shrooms is. Anyways, the high typically creeps up on me after that initial killer 5 mins too, like sometimes I think even over half an hour later it’ll hit super hard and I’ll have to drink water to calm down.
